Hi All,
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 I can only echo RT's letter=
.=A0 As a complete neophyte,=A0 any
questions I've had have always been ans=
wered in a timely fashion. Most often
the same day. This group has been a t=
remendous help to me in my quest for
information as I do not live in a Niho=
nto rich enviroment. And for that, I
am greatful to you all.=A0
=A0
Mark Ja=
illet
=A0

-----Original Message-----
From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [m=
ailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com]On
Behalf Of Richard Turner
Sent: Wednes=
day, September 28, 2005 7:57 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: R=
e: [nihontostudy] A change of direction ...


Hi John, I find all the group=
s go through quiet periods. I also find
that whenever I post a question her=
e, they are answered in time. It may
take a few days or sometimes a week bu=
t I seem to get my answers. I
guess it depends on how busy people are. I kn=
ow Jim is very busy a lot
of the time. I also think a lot of folk feel they=
 are better off not
saying anything at all rather than answering with uncer=
tainty and that
may be why questions go answered.

Just some thoughts.

Ric=
hard Turner



Dr John P Lissenden wrote:

>
>
> Dear members
>
> Surely I =
am not alone in bemoaning the apparent demise of this
> Nihontostudy group?=
=A0 Once a vibrant and educational medium for many
> people sharing our int=
erest, it is now a shadow of its former self.
> Messages are posted far les=
s frequently, and often remain unanswered.
> Those that are answered seem t=
o produce a rash of self-indulgent
> repartee between a few, select members=
 which the remainder of us find
> unamusing and tedious.
>
> Is there any h=
ope of a change of direction in order to restore this
> message board to it=
s early promise?
>
> JPL.
>
>
>
>
